In just a few minutes via DVD, Dick Hardy provides coaching for leaders related to providing a hospitable environment for guests that is immediately actionable. The companion guide followed the content of the video presentation, and makes transferring the knowledge gained to volunteers very easy to do. It's a great resource for the price.

HOSPITALITY: 9 Aspects of Over-the-Top Hospitality highlights the most noticeable aspect of a healthy or unhealthy church.  Pastors and staff can perform in the pulpit and live messy private lives for a season.  Music can be bad, but over-looked.  Bathrooms may be unkept, but it is the hospitality of a church that is felt before anything else.  If the hospitality is lacking or non-existent, this is a major problem which directly leads to lack of growth.  The Bible says to make friends you must first show yourself friendly.  Or in this case, in order to make people want to come back and invite others to your church, you must be genuinely friendly.  People--especially worldy people--can sniff inauthenticity from a mile away and you don't want your church to have that kind of a reputation.  Dick's series will help you to improve [or create] a successful hospitality ministry as well as a hospitable spirit in your church.

We all "think" we're a welcoming church but this Coaching Video from Dick Hardy's "Make it Happen" series showed us we have a long way to go! Dick has identified 9 aspects of hospitality that are achievable and necessary in all of our churches. I encourage you to buy the video and then spend time with your staff pouring through the workbook. You will not regret this investment in your church!Hospitality: 9 Aspects of Over-the-Top Guest Hospitality

If you're looking for ways to step it up in your church, this video would be a great buy for you.  I'm really excited to implement some of the things Dick talked about & to see what a difference it will make!

As church leaders, we are continuously looking for new ways to welcome our visitors and guests.  Too often in the church today, visitors will leave feeling unwelcome and like an outsider.  In this ten-minute video, Dick Hardy explores nine aspects to over-the-top guest hospitality.  This teaching will give practical ideas that will directly influence your hospitality teams.  Additionally, it explores other ministries and areas of the church that may be hindering hospitality.

Each week, guests are coming through the church doors and leaving with a bad taste in their mouth.  This video teaching assists church leaders by showing potential ideas in better welcoming guests.  The welcomed guest is certainly more likely to return!  The first thing you can do to help your hospitality team be more inviting?  Pick up this video and make it happen!
